unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program, aiming to enhance grid efficiency and reduce power theft across the state. As of 27/10/2024, over 50,000 smart meters have been installed in Pune and Nagpur, with plans to expand the program to Nashik and Aurangabad by Q1 2025.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program, aiming to enhance grid efficiency and reduce power theft across the state. As of twenty seventh October two thousand and twenty four, over fifty thousand smart meters have been installed in Pune and Nagpur, with plans to expand the program to Nashik and Aurangabad by Q one two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The smart meters, manufactured by Indian firm Secure Meters, offer real-time data on energy consumption, enabling consumers to monitor their usage patterns and manage their electricity bills effectively. This initiative is crucial for achieving the central government's goal of universal smart metering by December 31, 2025.
normalised: The smart meters, manufactured by Indian firm Secure Meters, offer real time data on energy consumption, enabling consumers to monitor their usage patterns and manage their electricity bills effectively. This initiative is crucial for achieving the central government's goal of universal smart metering by December thirty one, two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: "This technology will empower consumers to become more conscious about their energy usage, much like keeping a close watch on their household budget during Diwali," stated Mr. Patil, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press conference held earlier today at 11:00 hrs. The advanced metering infrastructure is expected to save the state approximately Rs. 200 crores annually by reducing transmission and distribution losses. A pilot project launched on 15/08/2023 in Baramati has already demonstrated a 15% reduction in Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: "This technology will empower consumers to become more conscious about their energy usage, much like keeping a close watch on their household budget during Diwali," stated Mister Patil, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press conference held earlier today at eleven hundred hours. The advanced metering infrastructure is expected to save the state approximately rupee two hundred crore annually by reducing transmission and distribution losses. A pilot project launched on fifteenth August two thousand and twenty three in Baramati has already demonstrated a fifteen percent reduction in Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses.
